_comment: BGP-Enabled Mastra Server on Port 4111 (Alternative Configuration)

_architecture_benefits.direct_bgp: Mastra server can directly participate in BGP network
_architecture_benefits.agent_discovery: Can discover agents from other AS without external proxy
_architecture_benefits.redundancy: Multiple BGP entry points for resilience
_architecture_benefits.full_network: Every Mastra server becomes a BGP node

_vs_simple_config.simple: Mastra just hosts agents, BGP proxy handles routing
_vs_simple_config.bgp_enabled: Mastra hosts agents AND can route to other AS directly
_vs_simple_config.complexity: BGP-enabled is more complex but more capable
_vs_simple_config.use_case: Choose based on whether you want Mastra to be BGP-aware
